qas.question: What was the German constitution later amended to say about the citizens of the 16 states?

answers.text: had successfully achieved the unity of Germany

qas.question: Article 23, before it was rephrased allowed what?

answers.text: "any other parts of Germany" to join

qas.question: Which state was Article 23 used to reintegrate?
The amended article 23 now defines the participation of the Federal Council and what else?
What was amended to signify that Basic Law no longer applied to the German people?

plausible_answers.text: allowed "any other parts of Germany" to join

qas.question: How was article 23 rephrased to reintegrate the Saar Protectorate?
What was used as a model for German Reunification in 1980?
Which article does the Federal Council define?
How many states are a part of the German Union?

context: Later, <b4_0>the constitution<b4_0/> was amended to state that the citizens of the 16 states <a0_0>had successfully achieved the unity of Germany<a0_0/> in free self-determination and that the Basic Law thus applied to the entire German people. <b6_0><b7_0>Article 23<b7_0/><b6_0/>, which had <b5_0>allowed <a1_0>"any other parts of Germany" to join<b5_0/><a1_0/>, was rephrased. It had been used in 1957 to reintegrate the <a2_0>Saar Protectorate<a2_0/> as the Saarland into the Federal Republic, and this was used as a model for German reunification in 1990. The amended article now defines the participation of the Federal Council and <a3_0>the <b8_0>16<b8_0/> German states<a3_0/> in matters concerning the European Union.
